description.zh-cn: 指在中华人民共和国文化大革命初期的1966年8月，于首都北京市发生的一系列屠杀事件。
description.en: A series of massacres that took place in Beijing, the capital of the People's Republic of China, in August 1966 during the early stages of the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 指1966年5月至1976年10月在中国由毛泽东发动和领导的政治运动。
description.en: A political movement in China from May 1966 to October 1976, launched and led by Mao Zedong.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命期间由大中学生组成的群众性组织，是红八月屠杀事件的主要执行者。
description.en: A mass organization of high school and university students during the Cultural Revolution, who were the main perpetrators of the Red August massacres.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会主席，文化大革命的发动者和领导者。
description.en: Chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, who launched and led the Cultural Revolution.

en: Mao Zedong's meeting with Red Guards

description.zh-cn: 1966年8月至11月间，毛泽东在北京天安门城楼上多次接见来自全国各地的红卫兵，极大地鼓舞了红卫兵的士气。
description.en: From August to November 1966, Mao Zedong met with Red Guards from all over the country on the Tiananmen Rostrum in Beijing, which greatly boosted their morale.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命时期对“地、富、反、坏、右”五类人的统称，是红八月期间被批斗和屠杀的主要对象。
description.en: A collective term during the Cultural Revolution for landlords, rich peasants, counter-revolutionaries, bad elements, and rightists, who were the main targets of struggle sessions and massacres during Red August.

description.zh-cn: 红八月期间在北京大兴县爆发的屠杀事件，325名“黑五类”分子及家属遇害。
description.en: A massacre that occurred in Daxing County, Beijing during Red August, in which 325 members of the 'Five Black Categories' and their families were killed.

description.zh-cn: 中国知名作家，在八二三事件后因遭红卫兵批斗和迫害，投太平湖自尽。
description.en: A renowned Chinese writer who committed suicide by drowning in Taiping Lake after being persecuted and struggled against by Red Guards following the August 23rd Incident.

description.zh-cn: 时任中国公安部部长，在红八月期间发表讲话，提出要保护红卫兵，不要拘捕打死人的红卫兵。
description.en: Then Minister of Public Security of China, who gave speeches during Red August, stating that Red Guards should be protected and those who killed people should not be arrested.

nodes.id: 中国共产党中央委员会

zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会
en: Central Committee of the Communist Party of China

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党的中央领导机构。
description.en: The central leading body of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 指文化大革命期间由红卫兵等组织发起的暴力和迫害行为，红八月被认为是其源头。
description.en: Refers to the violence and persecution initiated by organizations such as the Red Guards during the Cultural Revolution, with Red August considered its origin.

description.zh-cn: 中国知名翻译家，在上海“红八月”期间因遭红卫兵批斗迫害，与夫人一同自缢身亡。
description.en: A renowned Chinese translator who, along with his wife, committed suicide by hanging in Shanghai during the 'Red August' period after being persecuted and struggled against by Red Guards.

description.zh-cn: 1966年5月16日中共中央政治局扩大会议通过的关于“文化大革命”的纲领性文件，其发布标志着文化大革命的开始。
description.en: A programmatic document on the 'Cultural Revolution' passed by an enlarged meeting of the Politburo of the CPC Central Committee on May 16, 1966, its issuance marked the beginning of the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 时任中华人民共和国主席，在文化大革命初期因派遣工作组等问题与毛泽东产生分歧，后遭到批判和迫害。
description.en: Then President of the People's Republic of China, who had disagreements with Mao Zedong over issues such as dispatching work groups in the early stages of the Cultural Revolution, and was later criticized and persecuted.

description.zh-cn: 时任中共中央总书记，在文化大革命初期因派遣工作组等问题与毛泽东产生分歧而受到批判。
description.en: Then General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee, who was criticized for disagreeing with Mao Zedong over issues such as dispatching work groups in the early stages of the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 1966年6月初由刘少奇、邓小平等决定派往各大中学校协助领导运动的组织，后被毛泽东批评为“起坏作用，阻碍运动”并被撤销。
description.en: Organizations dispatched by Liu Shaoqi, Deng Xiaoping and others in early June 1966 to universities and middle schools to assist in leading the movement. They were later criticized by Mao Zedong for 'playing a bad role and hindering the movement' and were subsequently withdrawn.

description.zh-cn: 时任北京师范大学附属女子中学副校长，于1966年8月5日被该校红卫兵打死，成为北京第一个被打死的教育工作者。
description.en: Then Vice Principal of the Experimental High School Attached to Beijing Normal University. She was beaten to death by Red Guards of the school on August 5, 1966, becoming the first educator killed in Beijing.

nodes.id: 炮打司令部——我的一张大字报

zh-cn: 炮打司令部——我的一张大字报
en: Bombard the Headquarters — My First Big-Character Poster

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东于1966年8月5日发表的大字报，不点名地指责刘少奇等人“实行白色恐怖”。
description.en: A big-character poster published by Mao Zedong on August 5, 1966, which implicitly accused Liu Shaoqi and others of 'implementing a White Terror'.

description.zh-cn: 中共中央副主席、中央军委副主席，在中共八届十一中全会上接替刘少奇成为党内第二号人物。
description.en: Vice Chairman of the CPC Central Committee and Vice Chairman of the Central Military Commission, who replaced Liu Shaoqi as the second-in-command of the party at the Eleventh Plenary Session of the 8th CPC Central Committee.

en: Eleventh Plenary Session of the 8th Central Committee of the CPC

description.zh-cn: 1966年8月在北京举行的中国共产党第八届中央委员会第十一次全体会议，会议通过了《十六条》，批判了刘少奇，林彪成为党内二号人物。
description.en: The Eleventh Plenary Session of the 8th Central Committee of the CPC held in Beijing in August 1966. The session passed the 'Sixteen Points', criticized Liu Shaoqi, and established Lin Biao as the party's second-in-command.

description.zh-cn: 时任中华人民共和国国务院总理。在红八月期间，曾下令处决与红卫兵发生冲突的市民家属，并派解放军保护红卫兵抄家。
description.en: Then Premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China. During Red August, he ordered the execution of a family member of a citizen who clashed with Red Guards and dispatched the PLA to protect the Red Guards during home raids.

description.zh-cn: 市民李文波之妻。李文波在被红卫兵抄家殴打时抵抗并被打死，随后周恩来下令将刘文秀判处死刑并枪决。
description.en: Wife of citizen Li Wenbo. When Li Wenbo resisted while being beaten during a home raid by Red Guards and was killed, Zhou Enlai subsequently ordered Liu Wenxiu to be sentenced to death and executed by firing squad.

description.zh-cn: 中国考古学家、诗人，因在红八月期间遭到批斗迫害，于北京自缢身亡。
description.en: A Chinese archaeologist and poet who committed suicide by hanging in Beijing after being persecuted and struggled against during Red August.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国政治人物。因其父习仲勋在文革中受迫害，他在红八月期间沦为“黑五类”子弟，在学校被红卫兵殴打、游街。
description.en: A politician of the People's Republic of China. Because his father Xi Zhongxun was persecuted during the Cultural Revolution, he became a child of the 'Five Black Categories' during Red August and was beaten and paraded through the streets by Red Guards at school.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国前主要领导人之一，在文化大革命期间受到迫害。
description.en: One of the former main leaders of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, who was persecuted during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 北京师范大学附属女子中学红卫兵。1966年8月18日，她在天安门城楼上为毛泽东戴上红卫兵袖章，毛泽东建议她“要武嘛”。
description.en: A Red Guard at the Experimental High School Attached to Beijing Normal University. On August 18, 1966, she put a Red Guard armband on Mao Zedong on the Tiananmen Rostrum, and Mao suggested she should 'be martial' (要武嘛).

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命期间的最高领导机构之一。曾发布内部简报，将红八月的屠杀事件视为“累累战果”。
description.en: One of the highest leading bodies during the Cultural Revolution. It once issued an internal briefing that regarded the Red August massacres as 'fruitful results'.

description.zh-cn: 红八月是文化大革命初期发生的一系列事件。
description.en: Red August was a series of events that occurred in the early stages of the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 《五·一六通知》的发布标志着文化大革命的开始。
description.en: The issuance of the 'May 16 Notification' marked the beginning of the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东发动并领导了文化大革命。
description.en: Mao Zedong launched and led the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 1966年8月18日，毛泽东第一次接见红卫兵，红卫兵受到鼓舞，随即在北京展开大规模杀戮。
description.en: On August 18, 1966, Mao Zedong met with the Red Guards for the first time. Encouraged by this, the Red Guards immediately began large-scale killings in Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东通过致信、多次接见和发表讲话等方式，公开表示支持红卫兵运动，反对干涉学生文革。
description.en: Mao Zedong publicly supported the Red Guard movement and opposed interference in the students' Cultural Revolution through letters, multiple meetings, and speeches.

description.zh-cn: “黑五类”及其家属是红八月期间被批斗和屠杀的主要对象。
description.en: The 'Five Black Categories' and their families were the main targets of struggle sessions and massacres during Red August.

description.zh-cn: 1966年8月5日，北京师范大学附属女子中学的红卫兵将时任学校副校长卞仲耘活活打死。
description.en: On August 5, 1966, Red Guards from the Experimental High School Attached to Beijing Normal University beat Vice Principal Bian Zhongyun to death.

description.zh-cn: 知名作家老舍因在红八月期间遭到红卫兵批斗迫害，于1966年8月24日投湖自尽。
description.en: Renowned writer Lao She committed suicide by drowning on August 24, 1966, after being persecuted and struggled against by Red Guards during Red August.

description.zh-cn: 考古学家、诗人陈梦家因在红八月期间遭到批斗迫害，于1966年9月3日自缢身亡。
description.en: Archaeologist and poet Chen Mengjia committed suicide by hanging on September 3, 1966, after being persecuted and struggled against during Red August.

description.zh-cn: 知名翻译家傅雷因在上海“红八月”期间遭到红卫兵批斗迫害，于1966年9月3日与夫人自缢身亡。
description.en: Renowned translator Fu Lei, along with his wife, committed suicide by hanging on September 3, 1966, after being persecuted and struggled against by Red Guards during the 'Red August' in Shanghai.

description.zh-cn: 时任公安部长谢富治发表讲话，要求保护红卫兵，并表示“打死就打死了，我们根本管不着”，纵容了暴力行为。
description.en: Then Minister of Public Security Xie Fuzhi gave speeches demanding the protection of Red Guards, stating, 'If they are killed, they are killed, we can't manage it at all,' thus condoning the violence.

description.zh-cn: 受到北京市区红卫兵杀戮的影响，北京大兴县爆发了“大兴事件”，数天内屠杀了325人。
description.en: Influenced by the killings by Red Guards in urban Beijing, the 'Daxing Incident' broke out in Daxing County, where 325 people were massacred within a few days.

relationships.source: 中国共产党中央委员会

description.zh-cn: 1966年8月底、9月初，由于事态严重，中共中央进行了多次干预，并发表社论《用文斗，不用武斗》，大屠杀才逐渐结束。
description.en: In late August and early September 1966, due to the severity of the situation, the CPC Central Committee intervened multiple times and published the editorial 'Use Struggle by Reasoning, Not by Coercion or Force,' which gradually ended the massacre.

description.zh-cn: 红八月被认为是中国文革期间“红色恐怖”的源头。
description.en: Red August is considered the origin of the 'Red Terror' during China's Cultural Revolution.

relationships.source: 炮打司令部——我的一张大字报

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东的大字报不点名地指责以刘少奇为首的中央领导“实行白色恐怖”，加剧了对刘少奇的批判。
description.en: Mao Zedong's big-character poster implicitly accused the central leadership headed by Liu Shaoqi of 'implementing a White Terror,' intensifying the criticism against him.

relationships.target: 炮打司令部——我的一张大字报

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东亲自撰写了这张大字报。
description.en: Mao Zedong personally wrote this big-character poster.

description.zh-cn: 在中共八届十一中全会上，林彪接替刘少奇成为中共党内第二号人物。
description.en: At the Eleventh Plenary Session of the 8th CPC Central Committee, Lin Biao replaced Liu Shaoqi as the second-in-command of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 在中共八届十一中全会上，刘少奇遭到批判，其在党内的地位由第二位降至第八位。
description.en: At the Eleventh Plenary Session of the 8th CPC Central Committee, Liu Shaoqi was criticized, and his ranking within the party dropped from second to eighth.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东批评刘少奇、邓小平派遣的工作组是“起坏作用，阻碍运动”，并于7月底决定撤销工作组。
description.en: Mao Zedong criticized the work groups dispatched by Liu Shaoqi and Deng Xiaoping as 'playing a bad role and hindering the movement,' and decided to withdraw them at the end of July.

description.zh-cn: 在“榄杆市事件”后，周恩来下令由北京市法院将李文波之妻刘文秀判处死刑，并于次日枪决。
description.en: After the 'Langan'shi Incident,' Zhou Enlai ordered the Beijing Municipal Court to sentence Li Wenbo's wife, Liu Wenxiu, to death, and she was executed by firing squad the next day.

description.zh-cn: 在“榄杆市事件”后，周恩来下令由政府组织“红卫兵联络站”并派人民解放军保护红卫兵的抄家行动。
description.en: After the 'Langan'shi Incident,' Zhou Enlai ordered the government to organize 'Red Guard Liaison Stations' and dispatched the People's Liberation Army to protect the Red Guards' home-raiding actions.

description.zh-cn: 习仲勋在文化大革命期间受到迫害。
description.en: Xi Zhongxun was persecuted during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 因父亲习仲勋遭到迫害，时为学生的习近平在红八月期间沦为“黑五类”子弟，在学校被红卫兵殴打、游街。
description.en: Because his father Xi Zhongxun was persecuted, Xi Jinping, then a student, became a child of the 'Five Black Categories' during Red August and was beaten and paraded through the streets by Red Guards at school.

description.zh-cn: 习近平是习仲勋的儿子。
description.en: Xi Jinping is the son of Xi Zhongxun.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东在天安门城楼接见宋彬彬，并对她说“要武嘛”，此事件极大地鼓舞了红卫兵的暴力行为。
description.en: Mao Zedong met Song Binbin on the Tiananmen Rostrum and told her to 'be martial,' an event that greatly encouraged the violent actions of the Red Guards.

description.zh-cn: 中央文革小组于1966年9月5日发出一期内部简报，标题为《把旧世界打得落花流水——红卫兵半个月来战果累累》，将屠杀事件视为文革的“战果”。
description.en: On September 5, 1966, the Cultural Revolution Group issued an internal briefing titled 'Smash the Old World to Smithereens—The Fruitful Results of the Red Guards in the Past Half Month,' treating the massacres as 'achievements' of the Cultural Revolution.
